intro: Epilobium alpinum var. gracillimum, commonly known as the alpine willow herb, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink to purple flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh alpine environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats at high altitudes. This variant is notable for its compact growth form and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
